statements.name: PROC GDEVICE
statements.description: Starts the procedure. Can identify a device catalog and specify how that catalog is opened.

arguments.name: BROWSE
arguments.description: opens a catalog in Browse mode.

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: specifies the catalog containing device information.

arguments.name: NOFS
arguments.description: specifies that you are using program mode.

statements.name: ADD
statements.description: Adds a new device entry to the catalog selected by the CATALOG= option in the PROC GDEVICE statement. The device entry is initialized with NULL values for most parameters.
statements.help:
ADD  new-device-name 
	COLORS=(device-color-list)
	MODULE=driver-module
	XMAX=width <IN | CM>
	YMAX=width <IN | CM>
	XPIXELS=width-in-pixels
	YPIXELS=width-in-pixels
	device-rows-columns
	<optional-device-parameters>;

arguments.name: new-device-name
arguments.description: specifies the one-level name of the new device entry.

arguments.name: COLORS=
arguments.description: specifies one or more colors for the device.

arguments.name: MODULE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the driver module.

arguments.name: XMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum width of the device output.

arguments.name: YMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum height of the device output.

arguments.name: XPIXELS=
arguments.description: specifies the device output width in pixels.

arguments.name: YPIXELS=
arguments.description: specifies the device output height in pixels.

arguments.name: LCOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of landscape columns.

arguments.name: LROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of landscape rows.

arguments.name: PCOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of portrait columns.

arguments.name: PROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of portrait rows.

arguments.name: optional-device-parameters
arguments.description: specifies one or more optional device parameters and their values.

arguments.name: ASPECT=
arguments.description: Sets the aspect ratio for graphics elements.

arguments.name: scaling-factor
arguments.description: specifies a nonnegative integer or real number that determines the ratio of width to height for graphics elements.

arguments.name: AUTOCOPY=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to generate hard copy automatically.

arguments.name: AUTOFEED=
arguments.description: Specifies whether devices with continuous paper or automatic paper feed should roll or feed the paper automatically for the next graph.

arguments.name: CELL=
arguments.description: Controls whether to use cell alignment.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes the device to use cell alignment.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: suppresses cell alignment, causing the procedure to use the entire procedure output area and place axis and tick mark labels without regard to cell alignment.

arguments.name: CHARACTERS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the device-resident font is used when no font or FONT=NONE is specified in a SAS statement.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the device-resident font when you do not specify a font in a SAS program.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to draw the characters using the SIMULATE font and suppresses the use of all device—resident fonts, regardless of values that you specify in other SAS statements.

arguments.name: CHARREC=
arguments.description: Specifies a device-resident font by associating a CHARTYPE number with a device-resident font. Also defines a default size to use with that font.
arguments.help:
CHARREC= (
	type, rows, cols, 'font', 'Y' | 'N'
		<type, rows, cols, 'font', 'Y' | 'N'>
		< ...>)

arguments.name: CHARTYPE=
arguments.description: Selects the number of the default hardware character set.

arguments.name: hardware-font-chartype
arguments.description: specifies the hardware font character type as an integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: CIRCLEARC=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS/GRAPH should use the device's hardware circle-drawing capability, if available.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware circle- and arc-drawing capability of the device.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use software move and draw commands to draw circles and arcs.

arguments.name: CMAP=
arguments.description: Specifies a color map for the device.

arguments.name: COLORS=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors used to produce your graphics output if you do not specify colors explicitly in program statements.

arguments.name: (colors-list)
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS color names.
tells SAS/GRAPH to use only the colors that you explicitly specify in program statements and to ignore the ODS style colors.

arguments.name: COLORTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color space used by the user-written part of the Metagraphics device driver.
arguments.help: COLORTYPE= NAME | RGB | RGBA | HLS | GRAY | CMY | CMYK | HSV | HSB

arguments.name: NAME
arguments.description: specifies SAS predefined color names.

arguments.name: RGB
arguments.description: specifies red-green-blue (RGB) colors.

arguments.name: RGBA
arguments.description: specifies RGB colors with an alpha channel to control color opacity.

arguments.name: HLS
arguments.description: specifies hue-lightness-saturation(HLS) colors.

arguments.name: GRAY
arguments.description: specifies gray-scale level colors.

arguments.name: CMY
arguments.description: specifies cyan-magenta-yellow colors.

arguments.name: CMYK
arguments.description: specifies cyan-magenta-yellow-black colors..

arguments.name: HSV
arguments.description: specifies hue-saturation-value (HSV) colors.

arguments.name: HSB
arguments.description: specifies hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) colors.

arguments.name: DASH=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's hardware dashed-line capability, if available.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware dashed-line drawing capability of the device when generating graphics output.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to draw the dashed lines.

arguments.name: DASHLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies which dashed lines should be generated by hardware means if possible.

arguments.name: dashed-line-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies a 16-character hexadecimal string where each bit in the string corresponds to a line type. All 64 bits must be specified. Setting a bit to 1 selects the correspond line type.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Provides a description of the device entry.

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is a string up to 256 characters long.

arguments.name: DEVMAP=
arguments.description: Specifies the device map to be used when device-resident fonts are used.

arguments.name: device-map-name
arguments.description: is a string up to eight characters long that is the name of the device map entry.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that you do not want to use a device map.

arguments.name: DEVOPTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the hardware capabilities of the device.

arguments.name: hardware-capabilities-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies a 16-character hexadecimal string where each bit in the string corresponds to a device capability. All 64 bits must be specified. Setting a bit to 1 specifies the corresponding capability.

arguments.name: DEVTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the information required by SAS/GRAPH routines to determine the nature of the output device.

arguments.name: GTERM
arguments.description: indicates that the output device is a graphics device that will be receiving graphics data. Most device drivers use this value.

arguments.name: G3270
arguments.description: indicates that the output device is an IBM 3270 graphics data stream.

arguments.name: DRVINIT1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before driver initialization.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: DRVINIT2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before driver initialization.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: DRVQRY
arguments.description: specifies that the device can be queried for information about the current device configuration.

arguments.name: DRVTERM1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the driver terminates.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: DRVTERM2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the driver terminates.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: ERASE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to erase graph after display.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes the graph to be erased when you press Enter after the graph has been displayed.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes the graph to remain on the display when you press Enter after the graph has been displayed.

arguments.name: FILECLOSE=
arguments.description: Controls when the graphics stream file (GSF) is closed when you are using the device driver to send graphics output to a hard copy device.

arguments.name: DRIVERTERM
arguments.description: closes the GSF and makes it available to the device after all graphs have been produced and the procedure or driver terminates.

arguments.name: GRAPHEND
arguments.description: closes the GSF after each separate graph is produced and releases it to the device before sending another.

arguments.name: FILL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's hardware rectangle-fill capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware rectangle-filling capability of the device.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use software fills to fill rectangles.

arguments.name: FILLINC=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of pixels to move before drawing the next line in a software fill of a solid area.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Sets the file format of the metacode file produced by the part of the Metagraphics device driver that is supplied by SAS.

arguments.name: GACCESS=
arguments.description: Specifies the format or the destination or both of graphics data written to a traditional SAS/GRAPH device driver or to a graphics stream file (GSF).

arguments.name: SASGASTD
arguments.description: specifies that a continuous stream of data is written.

arguments.name: SASGAEDT
arguments.description: specifies that the file be host-specific edit format.

arguments.name: SASGAFIX
arguments.description: specifies that fixed-length records be written.

arguments.name: SASGALOG
arguments.description: specifies that records are to be written to the SAS log.

arguments.name: GSASFILE
arguments.description: specifies that the records are to be written to the destination whose fileref is GSASFILE.

arguments.name: 'output-format
arguments.description: specifies the destination in addition to one of these output format values: SASGASTD, SASGAEDT, or SASGAFIX.

arguments.name: GCOPIES=
arguments.description: Sets the current and maximum number of copies to be printed.

arguments.name: GEND=
arguments.description: Appends an ASCII string to every graphics data record that is sent to a device or file.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the ASCII string to append to every graphics data record that is sent to a device or file.

arguments.name: GEPILOG=
arguments.description: Sends a string to a device or file after all graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the string to a device or file after all graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: GPROLOG=
arguments.description: Sends a string to device or file before graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the string to a device or file before all graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: GPROTOCOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the protocol module to use when routing output directly to a printer or creating a graphics stream file (GSF) to send to a device attached to your host by a protocol converter.

arguments.name: module-name
arguments.description: specifies the protocol module name.

arguments.name: GSFLEN=
arguments.description: Controls the length of records written to the graphics stream file (GSF).

arguments.name: record-length
arguments.description: specifies the length of the records written by the driver to a GSF or to the device as an integer in the range 0–99999.

arguments.name: GSFMODE=
arguments.description: Specifies the disposition of records written to a graphics stream file (GSF) or to a device or communications port by the device driver.

arguments.name: APPEND
arguments.description: adds the records to the end of a GSF designated by the GACCESS= or GSFNAME= graphics option or device parameter.

arguments.name: PORT
arguments.description: sends the records to a device or communications port.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: replaces the existing contents of a GSF designated by the GACCESS= or GSFNAME= graphics option or device parameter.

arguments.name: GSFNAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref of the file or aggregate file location to which graphics stream file records are written.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a fileref that points to the destination for the graphics stream file (GSF) output.

arguments.name: GSIZE=
arguments.description: Sets the number of lines of display used for graphics for devices whose displays can be divided into graphics and text areas.

arguments.name: lines
arguments.description: specifies the number of lines to be used for graphics.

arguments.name: GSTART=
arguments.description: Prefixes every record of graphics data sent to a device or file with a string of characters.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the string that prefixes every record of graphics data sent to a device or file.

arguments.name: HANDSHAKE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of flow control used to regulate the flow of data to a hard copy device.

arguments.name: HARDWARE
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH instruct the device to use the hardware CTS and RTS signals for flow control.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH send data without providing flow control.

arguments.name: SOFTWARE
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH use programmed flow control with plotters in eavesdrop mode.

arguments.name: XONXOFF
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH instruct the device to use ASCII characters DC1 and DC3 for flow control.

arguments.name: HEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the command that executes a user-supplied program to create HEADER records for the driver.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: specifies a command that runs a user-written program that creates the file of HEADER records.

arguments.name: HEADERFILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref for the file from which the Metagraphics driver reads HEADER records.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: HORIGIN=
arguments.description: Sets the horizontal offset from the lower left corner of the display area to the lower left corner of the graph.

arguments.name: horizontal-offset
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal offset as a nonnegative integer optionally followed by a units specification of IN for inches (default), CM for centimeters, or PT for points.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: HOSTSPEC=
arguments.description: Stores FILENAME statement options in the device entry.

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies FILENAME statement options that are valid for the operating environment. Text-string accepts characters in upper or lower case.

arguments.name: HSIZE=
arguments.description: Sets the horizontal size of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: horizontal-size
arguments.description: specifies the width of the graphics output area as a positive number optionally followed by a units specification of IN for inches (default), CM for centimeters, or PT for points.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: ID=
arguments.description: Specifies the description string used by the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: is a character string up to 70 characters long.

arguments.name: INTERACTIVE=
arguments.description: Sets level of interactivity for Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: USER
arguments.description: specifies that the user-written part of the driver be executed outside of SAS/GRAPH.

arguments.name: GRAPH
arguments.description: specifies that the user-written part be invoked for each graph.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: specifies that the user-written part of the Metagraphics driver be invoked after the procedure is complete.

arguments.name: LCOLS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of columns in the graphics output area for landscape orientation.

arguments.name: landscape-columns
arguments.description: must be a nonnegative integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: LFACTOR=
arguments.description: Selects the default hardware line thickness.

arguments.name: line-thickness-factor
arguments.description: specifies the default hardware line thickness as an integer in the range 0–9999.

arguments.name: LROWS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of rows in the graphics output area for landscape orientation.

arguments.name: landscape-rows
arguments.description: is a nonnegative integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: MAXCOLORS=
arguments.description: Sets the total number of colors that can be displayed at once.

arguments.name: number-of-colors
arguments.description: specifies the number of colors that can be displayed at once as an integer in the range 2–256.

arguments.name: MAXPOLY=
arguments.description: Sets the maximum number of vertices for hardware-drawn polygons.

arguments.name: number-of-vertices
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of vertices for hardware-drawn polygons as an integer in the range 0–9999.

arguments.name: MODEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the model number of the output device.

arguments.name: model-number
arguments.description: specifies the model number designated by SAS for the corresponding device as an integer in the range 0–99999.

arguments.name: MODULE=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the corresponding executable driver module for the device.

arguments.name: driver-module
arguments.description: specifies the executable driver module name as a literal string up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: NAK=
arguments.description: Specifies the negative response for software handshaking for Metagraphics drivers.

arguments.name: negative-handshake-response
arguments.description: specifies the negative response for software handshaking for Metagraphics drivers as a hexadecimal string up to 16 characters long.

arguments.name: NODRVQRY
arguments.description: specifies that the device cannot be queried for information about the current device configuration.

arguments.name: PAPERFEED=
arguments.description: Specifies the increment of paper that is ejected when a graph is completed.

arguments.name: feed-increment
arguments.description: specifies the feed increment as a nonnegative number.

arguments.name: INCM
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN) or centimeters (CM).

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: Sets the increment of the angle for device-resident text rotation.

arguments.name: angle-increment
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which to rotate the text baseline as an integer in the range 0–360.

arguments.name: PCOLS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of columns in the graphics output area for portrait orientation.

arguments.name: portrait-columns
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns in the graphics output area for portrait orientation as an integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: PENSORT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether plotters draw graphics elements in order of color.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes the plotter to draw all graphics elements of one color at one time.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes the plotter to draw each element as it is encountered, regardless of its color.

arguments.name: PIEFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's hardware pie-fill capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware capability of the device, if available, to fill pies and pie sections.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to fill pies and pie sections using software pie fills.

arguments.name: POLYFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the hardware polygon-fill capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware capability of the device to fill polygons.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use software fills to fill polygons.

arguments.name: POSTGRAPH1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: POSTGRAPH2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: PREGRAPH1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: PREGRAPH2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: PROCESS=
arguments.description: Specifies the command that translates the metafile into commands for the device.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 40 characters that contains the command that translates the metafile produced by the Metagraphics driver into commands for the device.

arguments.name: PROCESSINPUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref for the file that contains input for the user-written part of the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: PROCESSOUTPUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref for the file that receives output from the user-written part of the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: PROMPT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether prompts are issued.
provides no prompting.
issues start-up messages only. Start-up messages are messages such as PLEASE PRESS RETURN TO CONTINUE.
signals end of graph if device is a video display or sends message to change paper if device is a plotter.
combines the effects of 1 and 2.
sends a message to mount pens if the device is a plotter.
combines the effects of 4 and 1.
combines the effects of 4 and 2.
sends all prompts.

arguments.name: PROMPTCHARS=
arguments.description: Selects the prompt characters to be used by SAS/GRAPH device drivers.

arguments.name: prompt-chars-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies the prompt characters to be used by SAS/GRAPH device drivers as an 8-byte hexadecimal string that is specified as 16 hexadecimal characters.

arguments.name: PROWS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of rows in the graphics output area for portrait orientation.

arguments.name: portrait-rows
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows in the graphics output area for portrait orientation as an integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: QMSG=
arguments.description: Specifies whether log messages are held until after the graphics output is displayed.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: queues driver messages while the device is in graphics mode (default for video devices).

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: prevents the queuing of messages (default for plotters, cameras, and printers).

arguments.name: RECTFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies which rectangle fills should be performed by hardware.

arguments.name: rectangle-fill-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies which rectangle fills should be performed by hardware as a hexadecimal string that is 16 characters long.

arguments.name: REPAINT=
arguments.description: Specifies how many times to redraw the graph.

arguments.name: redraw-factor
arguments.description: specifies how many times to redraw the graph as a integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether and how to rotate the graph.

arguments.name: LANDSCAPE
arguments.description: specifies landscape orientation (the graph is wider than it is high).

arguments.name: PORTRAIT
arguments.description: specifies portrait orientation (the graph is higher than it is wide).

arguments.name: ROTATION=
arguments.description: Sets the increment of the angle by which the device can rotate any given letter in a string of text in a Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: angle-increment
arguments.description: specifies the increment of the angle at which to rotate individual characters (for example, every 5 degrees, every 45 degrees, and so on).

arguments.name: SPEED=
arguments.description: Selects pen speed for plotters with variable speed selection.

arguments.name: pen-speed
arguments.description: specifies a percentage (1 through 100) of the maximum pen speed for the device.

arguments.name: SWAP=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to reverse BLACK and WHITE in the graphics output.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: swaps BLACK for WHITE and vice versa.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: does not swap the colors.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's symbol-drawing capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in symbol-drawing capability of the device, if available.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to draw the symbols using SAS/GRAPH fonts.

arguments.name: SYMBOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies which symbols can be generated by hardware.

arguments.name: hardware-symbols-hex-string
arguments.description: is a hexadecimal string that is 16 characters long and must be completely filled.

arguments.name: TRAILER=
arguments.description: Specifies the command that creates TRAILER records for the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: specifies a command that runs a user-written program that creates the TRAILER file.

arguments.name: TRAILERFILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref of the file from which the Metagraphics driver reads TRAILER records.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: TRANTAB=
arguments.description: Selects a translate table for your system that performs ASCII-to-EBCDIC translation.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: specifies a translate table stored as a SAS/GRAPH catalog entry.

arguments.name: user-defined-table
arguments.description: specifies the name of a user-created translate table.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of output device to which graphics commands are sent.
arguments.help: TYPE= CAMERA | CRT | EXPORT | PLOTTER | PRINTER

arguments.name: CAMERA
arguments.description: specifies a film-recording device.

arguments.name: CRT
arguments.description: specifies a monitor or terminal.

arguments.name: EXPORT
arguments.description: identifies the list in which the device appears under SAS/ASSIST software.

arguments.name: PLOTTER
arguments.description: specifies a pen plotter.

arguments.name: PRINTER
arguments.description: specifies a printer

arguments.name: UCC=
arguments.description: Sets the user-defined control characters for the device.

arguments.name: control-characters-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies the user-defined control characters for the device as a hexadecimal string that can be up 32 bytes (64 characters) long.

arguments.name: VORIGIN=
arguments.description: Sets the vertical offset from the lower left corner of the display area to the lower left corner of the graph.

arguments.name: vertical-offset
arguments.description: specifies the vertical offset as a nonnegative number.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: VSIZE=
arguments.description: Sets the vertical size of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: vertical-size
arguments.description: specifies the height of the graphics output area as a positive number.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: XMAX=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the addressable graphics display area; affects the horizontal resolution of the device and the horizontal dimension of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: specifies the width of the addressable graphics display area as a positive number.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: XPIXELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the addressable display area in pixels and in conjunction with XMAX determines the horizontal resolution for the device.

arguments.name: width-in-pixels
arguments.description: specifies the width of the addressable display area in pixels as an integer in the range 0–99999999.

arguments.name: YMAX=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the addressable graphics display area; affects the vertical resolution of the device and the vertical dimension of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: specifies the height of the addressable graphics display area as a positive number optionally followed by a units specification of IN for inches (default), CM for centimeters, or PT for points.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: YPIXELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the addressable display area in pixels and in conjunction with YMAX determines the horizontal resolution for the device.

arguments.name: height-in-pixels
arguments.description: specifies the height of the addressable display area in pixels as an integer in the range 0–99999999.

statements.name: COPY
statements.description: Copies a device entry and places the copy in the current catalog. The original device entry can be either in the current catalog or in a different catalog.

arguments.name: device-entry
arguments.description: specifies the one-level name of the device entry to copy.

arguments.name: FROM=
arguments.description: names the catalog from which to copy device-entry.

arguments.name: NEWNAME=
arguments.description: specifies a name for the copy of the device entry that is placed in the current catalog.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: Deletes the device entry from the current catalog.

arguments.name: device-entry
arguments.description: specifies the one-level name of device entry to delete.

statements.name: LIST
statements.description: Writes a list of all of the parameters of the specified device entry to the SAS log.

arguments.name: device-entry
arguments.description: specifies the one-level name of the device entry whose contents you want to list.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: lists only the name, description, and creation date of all device entries in the current catalog.

arguments.name: _NEXT_
arguments.description: lists the contents of the next device entry.

arguments.name: _PREV_
arguments.description: lists the contents of the previous device entry.

arguments.name: DUMP
arguments.description: lists detailed information about all device entries in the current catalog.

statements.name: MODIFY
statements.description: Changes the values in a device entry.

arguments.name: device-entry
arguments.description: specifies the one-level name of the device entry that you want to modify.

arguments.name: device-parameters
arguments.description: specifies the parameters that you want to modify.

arguments.name: ASPECT=
arguments.description: Sets the aspect ratio for graphics elements.

arguments.name: scaling-factor
arguments.description: specifies a nonnegative integer or real number that determines the ratio of width to height for graphics elements.

arguments.name: AUTOCOPY=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to generate hard copy automatically.

arguments.name: AUTOFEED=
arguments.description: Specifies whether devices with continuous paper or automatic paper feed should roll or feed the paper automatically for the next graph.

arguments.name: CELL=
arguments.description: Controls whether to use cell alignment.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes the device to use cell alignment.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: suppresses cell alignment, causing the procedure to use the entire procedure output area and place axis and tick mark labels without regard to cell alignment.

arguments.name: CHARACTERS=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the device-resident font is used when no font or FONT=NONE is specified in a SAS statement.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the device-resident font when you do not specify a font in a SAS program.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to draw the characters using the SIMULATE font and suppresses the use of all device—resident fonts, regardless of values that you specify in other SAS statements.

arguments.name: CHARREC=
arguments.description: Specifies a device-resident font by associating a CHARTYPE number with a device-resident font. Also defines a default size to use with that font.
arguments.help:
CHARREC= (
	type, rows, cols, 'font', 'Y' | 'N'
		<type, rows, cols, 'font', 'Y' | 'N'>
		< ...>)

arguments.name: CHARTYPE=
arguments.description: Selects the number of the default hardware character set.

arguments.name: hardware-font-chartype
arguments.description: specifies the hardware font character type as an integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: CIRCLEARC=
arguments.description: Specifies whether SAS/GRAPH should use the device's hardware circle-drawing capability, if available.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware circle- and arc-drawing capability of the device.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use software move and draw commands to draw circles and arcs.

arguments.name: CMAP=
arguments.description: Specifies a color map for the device.

arguments.name: COLORS=
arguments.description: Specifies the colors used to produce your graphics output if you do not specify colors explicitly in program statements.

arguments.name: (colors-list)
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS color names.
tells SAS/GRAPH to use only the colors that you explicitly specify in program statements and to ignore the ODS style colors.

arguments.name: COLORTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color space used by the user-written part of the Metagraphics device driver.
arguments.help: COLORTYPE= NAME | RGB | RGBA | HLS | GRAY | CMY | CMYK | HSV | HSB

arguments.name: NAME
arguments.description: specifies SAS predefined color names.

arguments.name: RGB
arguments.description: specifies red-green-blue (RGB) colors.

arguments.name: RGBA
arguments.description: specifies RGB colors with an alpha channel to control color opacity.

arguments.name: HLS
arguments.description: specifies hue-lightness-saturation(HLS) colors.

arguments.name: GRAY
arguments.description: specifies gray-scale level colors.

arguments.name: CMY
arguments.description: specifies cyan-magenta-yellow colors.

arguments.name: CMYK
arguments.description: specifies cyan-magenta-yellow-black colors..

arguments.name: HSV
arguments.description: specifies hue-saturation-value (HSV) colors.

arguments.name: HSB
arguments.description: specifies hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) colors.

arguments.name: DASH=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's hardware dashed-line capability, if available.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware dashed-line drawing capability of the device when generating graphics output.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to draw the dashed lines.

arguments.name: DASHLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies which dashed lines should be generated by hardware means if possible.

arguments.name: dashed-line-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies a 16-character hexadecimal string where each bit in the string corresponds to a line type. All 64 bits must be specified. Setting a bit to 1 selects the correspond line type.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Provides a description of the device entry.

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is a string up to 256 characters long.

arguments.name: DEVMAP=
arguments.description: Specifies the device map to be used when device-resident fonts are used.

arguments.name: device-map-name
arguments.description: is a string up to eight characters long that is the name of the device map entry.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that you do not want to use a device map.

arguments.name: DEVOPTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the hardware capabilities of the device.

arguments.name: hardware-capabilities-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies a 16-character hexadecimal string where each bit in the string corresponds to a device capability. All 64 bits must be specified. Setting a bit to 1 specifies the corresponding capability.

arguments.name: DEVTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the information required by SAS/GRAPH routines to determine the nature of the output device.

arguments.name: GTERM
arguments.description: indicates that the output device is a graphics device that will be receiving graphics data. Most device drivers use this value.

arguments.name: G3270
arguments.description: indicates that the output device is an IBM 3270 graphics data stream.

arguments.name: DRVINIT1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before driver initialization.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: DRVINIT2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before driver initialization.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: DRVQRY
arguments.description: specifies that the device can be queried for information about the current device configuration.

arguments.name: DRVTERM1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the driver terminates.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: DRVTERM2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the driver terminates.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 72 characters that contains one or more valid system commands and can be in upper- or lowercase letters.

arguments.name: ERASE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to erase graph after display.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes the graph to be erased when you press Enter after the graph has been displayed.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes the graph to remain on the display when you press Enter after the graph has been displayed.

arguments.name: FILECLOSE=
arguments.description: Controls when the graphics stream file (GSF) is closed when you are using the device driver to send graphics output to a hard copy device.

arguments.name: DRIVERTERM
arguments.description: closes the GSF and makes it available to the device after all graphs have been produced and the procedure or driver terminates.

arguments.name: GRAPHEND
arguments.description: closes the GSF after each separate graph is produced and releases it to the device before sending another.

arguments.name: FILL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's hardware rectangle-fill capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware rectangle-filling capability of the device.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use software fills to fill rectangles.

arguments.name: FILLINC=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of pixels to move before drawing the next line in a software fill of a solid area.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Sets the file format of the metacode file produced by the part of the Metagraphics device driver that is supplied by SAS.

arguments.name: GACCESS=
arguments.description: Specifies the format or the destination or both of graphics data written to a traditional SAS/GRAPH device driver or to a graphics stream file (GSF).

arguments.name: SASGASTD
arguments.description: specifies that a continuous stream of data is written.

arguments.name: SASGAEDT
arguments.description: specifies that the file be host-specific edit format.

arguments.name: SASGAFIX
arguments.description: specifies that fixed-length records be written.

arguments.name: SASGALOG
arguments.description: specifies that records are to be written to the SAS log.

arguments.name: GSASFILE
arguments.description: specifies that the records are to be written to the destination whose fileref is GSASFILE.

arguments.name: 'output-format
arguments.description: specifies the destination in addition to one of these output format values: SASGASTD, SASGAEDT, or SASGAFIX.

arguments.name: GCOPIES=
arguments.description: Sets the current and maximum number of copies to be printed.

arguments.name: GEND=
arguments.description: Appends an ASCII string to every graphics data record that is sent to a device or file.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the ASCII string to append to every graphics data record that is sent to a device or file.

arguments.name: GEPILOG=
arguments.description: Sends a string to a device or file after all graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the string to a device or file after all graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: GPROLOG=
arguments.description: Sends a string to device or file before graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the string to a device or file before all graphics commands are sent.

arguments.name: GPROTOCOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the protocol module to use when routing output directly to a printer or creating a graphics stream file (GSF) to send to a device attached to your host by a protocol converter.

arguments.name: module-name
arguments.description: specifies the protocol module name.

arguments.name: GSFLEN=
arguments.description: Controls the length of records written to the graphics stream file (GSF).

arguments.name: record-length
arguments.description: specifies the length of the records written by the driver to a GSF or to the device as an integer in the range 0–99999.

arguments.name: GSFMODE=
arguments.description: Specifies the disposition of records written to a graphics stream file (GSF) or to a device or communications port by the device driver.

arguments.name: APPEND
arguments.description: adds the records to the end of a GSF designated by the GACCESS= or GSFNAME= graphics option or device parameter.

arguments.name: PORT
arguments.description: sends the records to a device or communications port.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: replaces the existing contents of a GSF designated by the GACCESS= or GSFNAME= graphics option or device parameter.

arguments.name: GSFNAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref of the file or aggregate file location to which graphics stream file records are written.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a fileref that points to the destination for the graphics stream file (GSF) output.

arguments.name: GSIZE=
arguments.description: Sets the number of lines of display used for graphics for devices whose displays can be divided into graphics and text areas.

arguments.name: lines
arguments.description: specifies the number of lines to be used for graphics.

arguments.name: GSTART=
arguments.description: Prefixes every record of graphics data sent to a device or file with a string of characters.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the string that prefixes every record of graphics data sent to a device or file.

arguments.name: HANDSHAKE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of flow control used to regulate the flow of data to a hard copy device.

arguments.name: HARDWARE
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH instruct the device to use the hardware CTS and RTS signals for flow control.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH send data without providing flow control.

arguments.name: SOFTWARE
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH use programmed flow control with plotters in eavesdrop mode.

arguments.name: XONXOFF
arguments.description: specifies that SAS/GRAPH instruct the device to use ASCII characters DC1 and DC3 for flow control.

arguments.name: HEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the command that executes a user-supplied program to create HEADER records for the driver.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: specifies a command that runs a user-written program that creates the file of HEADER records.

arguments.name: HEADERFILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref for the file from which the Metagraphics driver reads HEADER records.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: HORIGIN=
arguments.description: Sets the horizontal offset from the lower left corner of the display area to the lower left corner of the graph.

arguments.name: horizontal-offset
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal offset as a nonnegative integer optionally followed by a units specification of IN for inches (default), CM for centimeters, or PT for points.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: HOSTSPEC=
arguments.description: Stores FILENAME statement options in the device entry.

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies FILENAME statement options that are valid for the operating environment. Text-string accepts characters in upper or lower case.

arguments.name: HSIZE=
arguments.description: Sets the horizontal size of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: horizontal-size
arguments.description: specifies the width of the graphics output area as a positive number optionally followed by a units specification of IN for inches (default), CM for centimeters, or PT for points.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: ID=
arguments.description: Specifies the description string used by the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: is a character string up to 70 characters long.

arguments.name: INTERACTIVE=
arguments.description: Sets level of interactivity for Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: USER
arguments.description: specifies that the user-written part of the driver be executed outside of SAS/GRAPH.

arguments.name: GRAPH
arguments.description: specifies that the user-written part be invoked for each graph.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: specifies that the user-written part of the Metagraphics driver be invoked after the procedure is complete.

arguments.name: LCOLS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of columns in the graphics output area for landscape orientation.

arguments.name: landscape-columns
arguments.description: must be a nonnegative integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: LFACTOR=
arguments.description: Selects the default hardware line thickness.

arguments.name: line-thickness-factor
arguments.description: specifies the default hardware line thickness as an integer in the range 0–9999.

arguments.name: LROWS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of rows in the graphics output area for landscape orientation.

arguments.name: landscape-rows
arguments.description: is a nonnegative integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: MAXCOLORS=
arguments.description: Sets the total number of colors that can be displayed at once.

arguments.name: number-of-colors
arguments.description: specifies the number of colors that can be displayed at once as an integer in the range 2–256.

arguments.name: MAXPOLY=
arguments.description: Sets the maximum number of vertices for hardware-drawn polygons.

arguments.name: number-of-vertices
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of vertices for hardware-drawn polygons as an integer in the range 0–9999.

arguments.name: MODEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the model number of the output device.

arguments.name: model-number
arguments.description: specifies the model number designated by SAS for the corresponding device as an integer in the range 0–99999.

arguments.name: MODULE=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the corresponding executable driver module for the device.

arguments.name: driver-module
arguments.description: specifies the executable driver module name as a literal string up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: NAK=
arguments.description: Specifies the negative response for software handshaking for Metagraphics drivers.

arguments.name: negative-handshake-response
arguments.description: specifies the negative response for software handshaking for Metagraphics drivers as a hexadecimal string up to 16 characters long.

arguments.name: NODRVQRY
arguments.description: specifies that the device cannot be queried for information about the current device configuration.

arguments.name: PAPERFEED=
arguments.description: Specifies the increment of paper that is ejected when a graph is completed.

arguments.name: feed-increment
arguments.description: specifies the feed increment as a nonnegative number.

arguments.name: INCM
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN) or centimeters (CM).

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: Sets the increment of the angle for device-resident text rotation.

arguments.name: angle-increment
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which to rotate the text baseline as an integer in the range 0–360.

arguments.name: PCOLS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of columns in the graphics output area for portrait orientation.

arguments.name: portrait-columns
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns in the graphics output area for portrait orientation as an integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: PENSORT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether plotters draw graphics elements in order of color.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes the plotter to draw all graphics elements of one color at one time.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes the plotter to draw each element as it is encountered, regardless of its color.

arguments.name: PIEFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's hardware pie-fill capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware capability of the device, if available, to fill pies and pie sections.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to fill pies and pie sections using software pie fills.

arguments.name: POLYFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the hardware polygon-fill capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in hardware capability of the device to fill polygons.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use software fills to fill polygons.

arguments.name: POSTGRAPH1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: POSTGRAPH2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed after the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: PREGRAPH1=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: PREGRAPH2=
arguments.description: Specifies host commands to be executed before the graph is produced.

arguments.name: system-command
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid system commands.

arguments.name: PROCESS=
arguments.description: Specifies the command that translates the metafile into commands for the device.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: specifies a character string of up to 40 characters that contains the command that translates the metafile produced by the Metagraphics driver into commands for the device.

arguments.name: PROCESSINPUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref for the file that contains input for the user-written part of the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: PROCESSOUTPUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref for the file that receives output from the user-written part of the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: PROMPT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether prompts are issued.
provides no prompting.
issues start-up messages only. Start-up messages are messages such as PLEASE PRESS RETURN TO CONTINUE.
signals end of graph if device is a video display or sends message to change paper if device is a plotter.
combines the effects of 1 and 2.
sends a message to mount pens if the device is a plotter.
combines the effects of 4 and 1.
combines the effects of 4 and 2.
sends all prompts.

arguments.name: PROMPTCHARS=
arguments.description: Selects the prompt characters to be used by SAS/GRAPH device drivers.

arguments.name: prompt-chars-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies the prompt characters to be used by SAS/GRAPH device drivers as an 8-byte hexadecimal string that is specified as 16 hexadecimal characters.

arguments.name: PROWS=
arguments.description: Sets the number of rows in the graphics output area for portrait orientation.

arguments.name: portrait-rows
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows in the graphics output area for portrait orientation as an integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: QMSG=
arguments.description: Specifies whether log messages are held until after the graphics output is displayed.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: queues driver messages while the device is in graphics mode (default for video devices).

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: prevents the queuing of messages (default for plotters, cameras, and printers).

arguments.name: RECTFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies which rectangle fills should be performed by hardware.

arguments.name: rectangle-fill-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies which rectangle fills should be performed by hardware as a hexadecimal string that is 16 characters long.

arguments.name: REPAINT=
arguments.description: Specifies how many times to redraw the graph.

arguments.name: redraw-factor
arguments.description: specifies how many times to redraw the graph as a integer in the range 0–999.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether and how to rotate the graph.

arguments.name: LANDSCAPE
arguments.description: specifies landscape orientation (the graph is wider than it is high).

arguments.name: PORTRAIT
arguments.description: specifies portrait orientation (the graph is higher than it is wide).

arguments.name: ROTATION=
arguments.description: Sets the increment of the angle by which the device can rotate any given letter in a string of text in a Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: angle-increment
arguments.description: specifies the increment of the angle at which to rotate individual characters (for example, every 5 degrees, every 45 degrees, and so on).

arguments.name: SPEED=
arguments.description: Selects pen speed for plotters with variable speed selection.

arguments.name: pen-speed
arguments.description: specifies a percentage (1 through 100) of the maximum pen speed for the device.

arguments.name: SWAP=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to reverse BLACK and WHITE in the graphics output.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: swaps BLACK for WHITE and vice versa.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: does not swap the colors.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use the device's symbol-drawing capability.

arguments.name: Y
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to use the built-in symbol-drawing capability of the device, if available.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: causes SAS/GRAPH to draw the symbols using SAS/GRAPH fonts.

arguments.name: SYMBOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies which symbols can be generated by hardware.

arguments.name: hardware-symbols-hex-string
arguments.description: is a hexadecimal string that is 16 characters long and must be completely filled.

arguments.name: TRAILER=
arguments.description: Specifies the command that creates TRAILER records for the Metagraphics driver.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: specifies a command that runs a user-written program that creates the TRAILER file.

arguments.name: TRAILERFILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref of the file from which the Metagraphics driver reads TRAILER records.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS fileref up to eight characters long.

arguments.name: TRANTAB=
arguments.description: Selects a translate table for your system that performs ASCII-to-EBCDIC translation.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: specifies a translate table stored as a SAS/GRAPH catalog entry.

arguments.name: user-defined-table
arguments.description: specifies the name of a user-created translate table.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of output device to which graphics commands are sent.
arguments.help: TYPE= CAMERA | CRT | EXPORT | PLOTTER | PRINTER

arguments.name: CAMERA
arguments.description: specifies a film-recording device.

arguments.name: CRT
arguments.description: specifies a monitor or terminal.

arguments.name: EXPORT
arguments.description: identifies the list in which the device appears under SAS/ASSIST software.

arguments.name: PLOTTER
arguments.description: specifies a pen plotter.

arguments.name: PRINTER
arguments.description: specifies a printer

arguments.name: UCC=
arguments.description: Sets the user-defined control characters for the device.

arguments.name: control-characters-hex-string
arguments.description: specifies the user-defined control characters for the device as a hexadecimal string that can be up 32 bytes (64 characters) long.

arguments.name: VORIGIN=
arguments.description: Sets the vertical offset from the lower left corner of the display area to the lower left corner of the graph.

arguments.name: vertical-offset
arguments.description: specifies the vertical offset as a nonnegative number.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: VSIZE=
arguments.description: Sets the vertical size of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: vertical-size
arguments.description: specifies the height of the graphics output area as a positive number.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: XMAX=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the addressable graphics display area; affects the horizontal resolution of the device and the horizontal dimension of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: specifies the width of the addressable graphics display area as a positive number.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: XPIXELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the addressable display area in pixels and in conjunction with XMAX determines the horizontal resolution for the device.

arguments.name: width-in-pixels
arguments.description: specifies the width of the addressable display area in pixels as an integer in the range 0–99999999.

arguments.name: YMAX=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the addressable graphics display area; affects the vertical resolution of the device and the vertical dimension of the graphics output area.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: specifies the height of the addressable graphics display area as a positive number optionally followed by a units specification of IN for inches (default), CM for centimeters, or PT for points.

arguments.name: INCMPT
arguments.description: specifies the units as inches (IN), centimeters (CM), or points (PT).

arguments.name: YPIXELS=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the addressable display area in pixels and in conjunction with YMAX determines the horizontal resolution for the device.

arguments.name: height-in-pixels
arguments.description: specifies the height of the addressable display area in pixels as an integer in the range 0–99999999.

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Saves all modifications made to device entries during the procedure and ends the procedure step.

statements.name: RENAME
statements.description: Changes the name of the device entry to the name specified in the statement.

arguments.name: device-entry-name
arguments.description: specifies the one-level name of the device entry that you want to rename.

arguments.name: NEWNAME=
arguments.description: specifies the new entry name.
